metadata.Title: CVE-2023-26606 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel 6.0.8, there is a use-after-free in ntfs_trim_fs in fs/ntfs3/bitmap.c. It was discovered that the NTFS file system implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly handle a loop termination condition, leading to an out-of-bounds read vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-26606` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-10-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-10-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-10-generic-64k - 6.1.0-16.16
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-aws - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-azure - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-gcp - 6.2.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 6.2.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-10-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-10-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1011-oracle - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1006-raspi - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-10-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-10-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-10-generic-64k - 6.1.0-16.16
No subscription required

No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> reproducer in gist According to SUSE, fixed in 557d19675a47 ("fs/ntfs3: Fix slab-out-of-bounds read in ntfs_trim_fs")
